message: What do people usually use for uploading slide decks from presentations? Slideshare?
I think Scribd was the best IMO.
I've used both Slideshare, Scribd, and just uploading things to my server.
It was the easiest process, it processed my slides fast, and then it kind of did some social networky things to show it to interested people.
but they keep acting like assholes (paywall...)
something on the scribd site just crashed the shockwave plugin in chrome :-(
I'll give it another try, though, since that's 3 recommendations for it.
Wait, I *have* to use facebook to login on scribd.com? Sigh.
Oh, nevermind, I can make a local account.
I've been uploading mine to github and shoving them in gh-pages, but most of them are HTML.
@bob what do you create your slides using?
It'd be awesome if Steve, John and Ordered List came out with this in the coming weeks: http://speakerdeck.com/
@alex typically reStructuredText and publish as S5, although I wish there was something better. Not motivated enough yet to build it myself though.
